Class Contacts.Person

java.lang.Object
Contacts.Person
Enclosing class:
Contacts
public class Contacts.Person extends Object
Inner class Person inside the Contacts class that stores Person attributes and has validation methods which check if user input is valid.

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      Person()
      Constructor without parameters. Creates a new person with empty attributes.

    • Person

      Person(String idNumber, String firstName, String lastName, String phoneNumber, String address, String email)
      Constructor with parameters for the filereader so attributes can be added straight from method that reads the data in file. If optional fields address and email are left empty, it is replaced with "-".
      Parameters:
      idNumber - Id number of person stored on file
      firstName - first name of person stored on file
      lastName - last name of person sotred on file
      phoneNumber - phone number of person stored on file
      address - address of person stored on file
      email - email of person stored on file

  • Method Details

    • setID

      public void setID(String idNumber)
      setID() method sets user input as Idnumber. Will also change it to uppercase if user gave input was given in lowercase so the validation method works correclty.
      Parameters:
      idNumber - user input to be added as Person objects ID number

    • setFirstName

      public void setFirstName(String firstName)
      setFirstName() method sets user input as first name.
      Parameters:
      firstName - user input that is set as first name of Person

      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - user input that is set as phone number of Person

    • setAddress

      public void setAddress(String address)
      setAddress() method sets user input as address. If empty, sets address as "-".
      Parameters:
      address - user input that is set as phone number of Person if left empty, replaced with "-"

    • setEmail

      public void setEmail(String email)
      setEmail() method sets user input as email address. If empty, sets email as "-".
      Parameters:
      email - user input that is set as email of Person if left empty, replaced with "-"

    • validateID

      public boolean validateID(String idNumber)
      Method that checks the validation of Id number based on social security number rules in Finland. Method checks for length, century sign and control character. Method also checks some numbers that can't be added as a birthdate. idNumber user input that will be validated. idValue takes the numeric values from ID Number to a String idNumValue makes idValue String into integer idRemainder stores remainder that is left over from deviding idNumValue with 31. This is used as the control character of social security number. controlChar arralist containing the control numbers. The idRemainder matches the index number of each control character.
      Parameters:
      idNumber - user input to be validated as proper ID number
      Returns:
      returns true if the validation is passed and id Number is valid

    • validateFirstName

      public boolean validateFirstName(String firstName)
      Method that checks the validation of first name. Regular expression is used to have some restrictions as to what can be considered a first name. Name cannot contain numbers or special characters other than unicode letters. "-"" and "'"" are accepted.
      Parameters:
      firstName - user input that is validated
      Returns:
      returns true if the name passes validation check

    • validateLastName

      public boolean validateLastName(String lastName)
      Method that checks the validation of last name. Regular expression is used to have some restrictions as to what can be considered a last name. Name cannot contain numbers or special characters other than unicode letters. "-"" and "'"" are accepted.
      Parameters:
      lastName - user input that is validated
      Returns:
      returns true if the name passes validation check

    • validatePhoneNumber

      public boolean validatePhoneNumber(String phoneNumber)
      Method that checks the validation of phone number. Regular expression is used to have some restrictions as to what can be considered a phone number. Phone number can only contain numbers, spaces, "+" or "-". Phone number has to be 6 - 20 characters long.
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - user input that is validated
      Returns:
      returns true if phone number passes the validation

    • validateAddress

      public boolean validateAddress(String address)
      Method that checks the validation of the address. Regular expression is used to have some restrictions as to what can be considered an address.Field can either be empty or Length must be between 3-50 characters, Can contain numbers, letters, unicode letters and some special characters like "-" , "." and "'".
      Parameters:
      address - user input that is validated
      Returns:
      returns true if address passes the validation

    • validateEmail

      public boolean validateEmail(String email)
      Method that checks the validation of the email address. Regular expression is used to have some restrictions as to what can be considered an email address. Field can be empty or it must contain a "@" and a dot and text between and before them. Dot cannot be right before or after "@", text need to be in between.
      Parameters:
      email - user input that is validated
      Returns:
      returns true if email address passes the validation

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString override to print personal data in a clean and readable way for the user
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
